property trajectory_filename¶
mfm.tools.modelling.trajectory.below_min_distance(xyz, min_distance, atom_list=array([], dtype=int32))[source]¶

Takes the xyz-coordinates (frame, atom, xyz) of a trajectory as an argument an returns a vector of booleans of length of the number of frames. The bool is False if the frame contains a atomic distance smaller than the min distance.

Parameters

  • xyz – numpy array The coordinates (frame fit_index, atom fit_index, coord)

  • min_distance – float Minimum distance if a distance

Returns

numpy-array If a atom-atom distance within a frame is smaller than min_distance the value within the array is True otherwise it is False.

mfm.tools.modelling.trajectory.rotate(xyz, rm)[source]¶

Rotates a trajectory (frame, atom, coord)

Parameters

  • xyz – numpy array The coordinates (frame fit_index, atom fit_index, coord)

  • rm – numpy array 3x3 dtpye np.float32 - the rotation matrix

Returns

Examples

>>> from mfm.structure.trajectory import TrajectoryFile
>>> import numpy as np
>>> traj = TrajectoryFile('stride_100.h5')
>>> xyz = traj.xyz
>>> b = np.array([[-0.856274009, 0.513258278, -0.057972118], [0.513934493, 0.835381866, -0.194957629], [-0.051634759, -0.196731016, -0.979096889]], dtype=np.float32)
>>> rotate(xyz, b)
